intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. sublaetevirens, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges, thriving in temperate climates. The plant features delicate, palmately divided leaves and showy yellow flowers with a distinctive central greenish disc. Its flowers are usually 3–5 cm in diameter and bloom from late spring to early summer. The subspecies is characterized by its slightly smaller and paler leaves compared to the typical form of Ranunculus auricomus.
